summary:
• Type: Options Grant under Share Option Plan
  • Options Issued: 3,059,190 (10.6% of total outstanding Options)
  • Exercise Price: NZ$0.65 (VWAP for 5 days prior to 26 May 2025)
  • Exercise Period: 10 business days after 2028 results announcement, expiring 90 days later
  • Settlement: Cashless (net-settled) exercise with shares issued based on market value vs. exercise price
  • Tax Treatment: OCA to cover tax on employee benefits; shares reduced if NZ tax exceeds OCA’s tax savings
  • Purpose: Retention/performance alignment for CEO and select employees
  • Total Options Outstanding Post-Issue: 31,677,802
  • Effective Date: 23 June 2025

No material trading or capital structure impact identified (dilution contingent on future exercise).

• Disposal of 10% stake in HTAL at A$0.032 per share (45% premium to Independent Expert's upper valuation range of A$0.022).
  • Expected proceeds: NZ$47 million (July 2025), to be used for net debt reduction.
  • Strategic rationale: Divestment aligns with Spark’s review of non-core assets.

No material information identified beyond the above.

• Takeover Scheme Announcement:
  • Acquirer: Shift4 Payments, LLC (US-based payment processor).
  • Offer Price: NZ$1.20 per share (all-cash).
  • Premiums/Discounts:
    • 46.5% premium to 90-day VWAP (NZ$0.82).
    • Implied equity value: ~NZ$296.4M / A$274.1M.
    • EV/EBITDA multiple: 14.2x (FY25 EBITDA: NZ$21.5M pre-NZ investment).
  • Conditions: Shareholder (>75% vote), NZ High Court, Overseas Investment Act approvals; no financing condition.
  • Timetable:
    • Shareholder meeting: Q3 2025.
    • Expected completion: Q4 2025.
  • Board/Significant Holder Support: Unanimous director recommendation; 13.3% holder Microequities Asset Management intends to vote in favor.
  • Break Fees: NZ$2.96M each way (reciprocal).
  • Exclusivity: Customary "no-shop" clauses with fiduciary outs for Superior Proposals.

Material Impact: Immediate liquidity event at premium valuation; derisks execution of standalone growth strategy.

Omitted: Operational details, advisor names, legal boilerplate.

Key Material Information:

  • Drilling Commencement: Diamond drilling has started at the Bousquet Gold Project (Quebec, Canada) with an initial phase of 2,400m (10 holes).
  • Approvals Secured: Permits granted for up to 10,000m (38 holes) across high-priority targets.
  • Priority Targets: Focus on Paquin Prospect (high-grade intercepts, e.g., 9m @ 16.96g/t Au) and Decoeur Prospect (regional Bousquet Fault).
  • Location Significance: Project lies on the Cadillac Break, a structure linked to major gold deposits (>110Moz Au).

No capital markets or trading-sensitive actions (e.g., raising, halt) identified.
